Metaphor:STATES ARE LOCATIONS

From EN MetaNet Wiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Name Gloss STATES ARE LOCATIONS
Name Transcription
Aliases

STATES ARE LOCATIONS (Philosophy in the Flesh,179)

STATE VALUES ARE LOCATIONS

STATES ARE LANDMARKS

Description
Comments "The derivation for STATES ARE LOCATIONS would imply that permanent 'states' - i.e., essential properties - should be harder to conceptualize as locations, since our understanding of these properties does not involve change. E.g. ?These cliffs are in/at a state of verticality. ?My dog is in a state of mammalhood." (Grady 1998:p. 107)

See Discussion for comments on 9/4/13 revision

Tags
Family Location Event Structure Metaphor, States are Locations metaphors, Grady Primary Metaphors
Metaphor Level General
Metaphor Type Primary
Experiential Basis The correlation between our location and how we feel. And/or the correlation between perceiving motion and being aware of a change in the world-state around us.
Cultural Scope
Source Frame Trajector landmark
Roles:trajector, background, landmark, profiled_region
Target Frame State
Roles:possible_state_values, value_relations, standard, profiled_state_value, state_holder, state_type


Mappings:

profiled_state_value <= profiled_region
standard <= landmark
state_type <= background
state_holder <= trajector

Related Metaphors:


Entailments:


Examples:

Entered by Oana, Ellen
Last reviewed by Ellen, Elise, Oana
Status in development, release candidate
